tweets.text: @LianaJane @malam_steven @SianieRoo @StinkStopthe @MattHancock @MPGeorgeEustice @BorisJohnson @DefraGovUK @EnvAgency @JamesBevanEA @ClareDinnisEA So why are you being so unsympathetic and seemingly unsupportive. You obviously experience it if you live there. Is there a reason your not being more understanding? Perhaps you need more empathy or perhaps just move on from commenting things that upset people even more.

They drain our chalk streams dry, dump over 3.1 million hours worth of sewage into our rivers and now this.

The water industry is the UKs' largest source of micro plastic pollution in rivers.

So much for regulation then. @Defra @Ofwat @EnvAgency 

https://t.co/Sb77dX1RmG

urls.title: Water firms are main source of microplastics in UK rivers, study says
urls.description: Research says discharge of untreated sewage and wastewater during dry spells to blame

tweets.text: The source of the #RiverVer. The sewage fungus & plastic tampon applicators alone say all is not well at the top of our #chalkstream. It's clearly a pollution issue that's been going on for months Does anyone really care? Uncovered by our citizen science water testing efforts. https://t.co/adfKtnKHuY

@LucyABeaumont @EnvAgencyNW We could smell it at work last week and our building is about 3.5 miles away from the landfill. Vile.

@LucyABeaumont @EnvAgencyNW Thanks @LucyABeaumont it really is toxic and really does stink and those in charge don‚Äôt seem to be doing anything‚Ä¶ we live 2 miles away and some days its unbearable. we thought there was a gasleak one day!

tweets.text: Don't know if it's the cause but the Great Crested Grebe family I've been watching there have died. üòü @EnvAgency https://t.co/yejU1lNKkt

Nice to catch up with this pair of swans yesterday, released recently after their treatment here at the Sanctuary for fuel contamination, leaked from a vehicle entering the water. They were returned to their territory following a successful clean up of the waterway by @EnvAgency https://t.co/cuqQujDY7d
